Ancient Summoning Rune.description: A cloud of invisible magical sensors in a 10-foot radius surrounds the central column of the room.
Ancient Summoning Rune.hazardDisable: @Check[acrobatics|dc:15|name:Approach the Rune|traits:magical,trap] to approach without triggering the trap followed by @Check[thievery|dc:17|name:Erase the Rune|traits:action:disable-a-device,magical,trap] (trained) to erase the rune, or @Check[athletics|dc:19|name:Remove Stones|traits:magical,trap] to remove enough stones from the pillar to disrupt the magic, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (1st level; counteract DC 15) to counteract the rune.
Ancient Summoning Rune.hazardReset: The trap resets each day at dawn.
Ancient Summoning Rune.name: Ancient Summoning Rune

Befuddled Thoughts.description: The fanged skull rune begins speaking in sweet, honeyed tones about eternal life.
Befuddled Thoughts.hazardDisable: @Check[religion|dc:20|name:Exorcise Spirit|traits:complex,haunt] (trained) to exorcise the spirit, @Check[religion|dc:21|name:Sever Spiritual Connection|traits:complex,haunt] or @Check[occultism|dc:21|name:Sever Spiritual Connection|traits:complex,haunt] (trained) to sever the connection between Hunger's Call and the temple, or @Check[athletics|dc:21|name:Crack the Wall|traits:complex,haunt] to crack the wall in several places; three total successes are required to disable the haunt.
Befuddled Thoughts.hazardReset: The mosaic ceases its routine 2 rounds after all living creatures are out of sight of the stairs. After 6 hours the haunt is ready to trigger again.
Befuddled Thoughts.hazardRoutine: (3 actions) A pulsing red ball of energy flies from the wall and explodes in negative energy in the room. Anyone in the room takes @Damage[(1d10+4)[void]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic|name:Avoid the Energy|traits:complex,haunt,void] save).
Befuddled Thoughts.name: Befuddled Thoughts

Blood Hunger.description: Blood flows from the fanged skull rune as if it were an open wound.
Blood Hunger.hazardDisable: @Check[religion|dc:20|name:Exorcise Spirit|traits:complex,haunt] (trained) to exorcise the spirit, @Check[religion|dc:21|name:Sever Spiritual Connection|traits:complex,haunt] or @Check[occultism|dc:21|name:Sever Spiritual Connection|traits:complex,haunt] (trained) to sever the connection between Hunger's Call and the temple, or @Check[crafting|dc:21|name:Break up the Mural|traits:complex,haunt] (trained) to break up the pattern of the mural; three total successes are required to disable the haunt.
Blood Hunger.hazardReset: The mosaic ceases its routine 2 rounds after all living creatures are out of sight of the stairs. After 6 hours the haunt is ready to trigger again.
Blood Hunger.hazardRoutine: (3 actions) The bloody mosaic blasts shards of colored glass at anyone within 10 feet of the eastern wall, and they each take @Damage[1d10[slashing]] damage plus @Damage[1[bleed]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic|name:Avoid the Glass Shards|traits:complex,haunt,slashing] save; critical success negates the bleed damage).
Blood Hunger.name: Blood Hunger

Cheerful Tune.description: A cheerful, wordless tune fills the room, compelling everyone to get to work.
Cheerful Tune.hazardDisable: @Check[religion|dc:20|name:Exorcise Spirits|traits:complex,haunt] (trained) to exorcise the spirits, or @Check[intimidation|dc:21|name:Take a Break|traits:complex,haunt] to convince the spirits it is time to take a break; three total successes are required to disable the haunt.
Cheerful Tune.hazardReset: The ghostly workers cease their routine 2 rounds after all living creatures leave the room and reset after 6 hours.
Cheerful Tune.hazardRoutine: (3 actions) Ghostly workers appear in the room and begin abrading, scrubbing, and splashing cleaning chemicals on anyone in the area. Each creature in the room takes @Damage[(1d4+2)[slashing]] and @Damage[(1d4+2)[acid]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic|name:Avoid Workers|traits:haunt,complex] save; roll once for both).
Cheerful Tune.name: Cheerful Tune

Cleaning Agents.description: Solvents and detergents spray from the ceiling and run down the walls where they combine in dangerous ways.
Cleaning Agents.hazardDisable: @Check[engineering-lore|dc:20|name:Disable Control Panel|traits:mechanical,complex]{Engineering Lore} (trained) or @Check[thievery|dc:20|name:Disable Control Panel|traits:mechanical,complex] (trained) to deactivate the control panel, or @Check[athletics|dc:21|name:Plug the Spouts|traits:mechanical,complex] or @Check[acrobatics|dc:21|name:Plug the Spouts|traits:mechanical,complex] to plug the spouts that release the chemicals; three successes are required to disable the trap.
Cleaning Agents.hazardReset: The trap deactivates after 1 minute and resets in 1 hour.
Cleaning Agents.hazardRoutine: (3 actions) The trap fills the room with a cloud of caustic vapor and deals @Damage[(2d6+2)[acid]] damage to all creatures in the area (@Check[fortitude|dc:20|basic|name:Cleaning Agent|traits:acid]).
Cleaning Agents.name: Cleaning Agents

Encouraging Supervision.description: The face of the Azlanti supervisor on the wall animates and begins scolding those in the room for their poor attitudes at work.
Encouraging Supervision.hazardDisable: @Check[deception|dc:20|name:Fake a Smile|traits:complex,haunt] to fake a cheerful, positive attitude, or @Check[crafting|dc:21|name:Show Skill at a Task|traits:complex,haunt] (trained) to show skill at a task; three successful checks are required to disable the haunt.
Encouraging Supervision.hazardReset: The ghostly voice ceases its routine 2 rounds after all living creatures leave the room and resets after 6 hours.
Encouraging Supervision.hazardRoutine:
(3 actions) The supervisor's voice fills the room and compels everyone within to start smiling. Each creature in the room takes @Damage[(1d8+4)[mental]] damage and must attempt a @Check[will|dc:20|name:Try Not to Smile too Hard|traits:complex,haunt] save.

Critical Success The target takes no damage.

Success The target takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage.

Critical Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}.
Encouraging Supervision.name: Encouraging Supervision

Ghoul (PFS Intro 2).description:
Ghouls are ravenous undead who haunt graveyards and eat corpses.

Few creatures are more ubiquitous to sinister locations such as lonely graveyards and ruined crypts than the flesh-eating undead known as ghouls.

Ev6vuAb8rqAKu6ss.description:
Requirements The ghoul is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour.

Effect The ghoul devours a chunk of the corpse and regains @Damage[1d6[healing]] Hit Points.

It can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.
Ev6vuAb8rqAKu6ss.name: Consume Flesh

TwoYirIOl1z1WbOZ.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:15]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[3d8[void]] damage and regains half as many Hit Points from all healing (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 @Damage[3d8[void]] damage and gains no benefit from healing (1 day)

Stage 5 as stage 4 (1 day)

Stage 6 dead, and rises as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.LHHgGSs0ELCR4CYK]{Ghoul} the next midnight.
TwoYirIOl1z1WbOZ.name: Ghoul Fever

rLNDBZSXuC3QhpxX.description: Any living, non-elf creature hit by a ghoul's attack must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:15] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.
rLNDBZSXuC3QhpxX.name: Paralysis

Ghoul (PFS Intro 2).name: Ghoul (PFS Intro 2)

Ln8ZtQy8JZzqvbgp.description: Rain in Cloudy Day can unleash a cloud of spores that irritates the eyes and throats of nonfungi creatures in a @Template[emanation|distance:15]. Each creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:16] save or take @Damage[1[persistent,poison]] damage. A creature has its vision reduced as long as the persistent damage continues and can see only within 20 feet (10 feet on a critical failure).
Ln8ZtQy8JZzqvbgp.name: Spore Cloud

PSd8ZUnIEeTZZ3Qc.description: When Rain in Cloudy Day dies, a burst of primal energy explodes from his body, restoring @Damage[2d8[healing]] Hit Points to each plant creature in a @Template[emanation|distance:30]. This area is filled with fungi, becoming difficult terrain. If the terrain is not a viable environment for this fungus, it withers after 24 hours.
PSd8ZUnIEeTZZ3Qc.name: Verdant Burst

Qo6Zya98KMBBIXlg.description: A creature that takes damage from Rain in Cloudy Day's spore pod Strike must attempt a saving throw with the same DC and effect as his Spore Cloud ability.
Qo6Zya98KMBBIXlg.name: Spores

f4Bxn2vuVItRYQrZ.description: Rain in Cloudy Day transforms into a Small giant mushroom or patch of fungi. This ability otherwise uses the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.dileJ0Yxqg76LMvu]{One with Plants}.
f4Bxn2vuVItRYQrZ.name: Change Shape

Spiked Pit.description: A wooden trapdoor covers a pit that's 10 feet square and 20 feet deep. Sharp spikes line the bottom of the pit.
Spiked Pit.hazardDisable: @Check[thievery|dc:14|name:Remove Trap Door|traits:mechanical,trap] to remove the trapdoor
Spiked Pit.hazardReset: Creatures can still fall into the trap, but the trapdoor must be reset manually for the trap to become hidden again.
Spiked Pit.name: Spiked Pit

Spite of the Righteous.description: The image of a ghostly warrior her holy symbol dripping blood and pulsing with negative energy, steps from the wall and seeks to kill any living creature.
Spite of the Righteous.hazardDisable: @Check[religion|dc:20|name:Exorcise Spirit|traits:complex,haunt] (trained) to exorcise the spirit, @Check[religion|dc:21|name:Sever Spiritual Connection|traits:complex,haunt] or @Check[occultism|dc:21|name:Sever Spiritual Connection|traits:complex,haunt] (trained) to sever the connection between Hunger's Call and the temple, or @Check[thievery|dc:21|name:Scratch Eyes out of the Mural|traits:complex,haunt] (trained) to scratch the eyes out of the mural; three total successes are required to disable the haunt.
Spite of the Righteous.hazardReset: The spectral warrior returns to the wall and ceases 2 rounds after all living creatures are out of sight of the stairs. After 6 hours the haunt is ready to trigger again.
Spite of the Righteous.hazardRoutine: (3 actions) The warrior's blade sweeps through the bodies of any living creature within sight of the exit stairs, and they each take @Damage[(1d10+4)[slashing]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:20|basic|name:Avoid the Warrior's Blade|traits:complex,haunt,slashing] save). Undead creatures in the area gain 5 temporary hit points.
Spite of the Righteous.name: Spite of the Righteous

Sun-Scorched Shadow Drake.description: Shadow drakes are typically among the smallest and least powerful of their species. Most stand as tall and long as house cats and have charcoal-colored scales and membranous wings just translucent enough to pass for shadows. Attracted to shiny materials, they employ deception, teamwork, and even rudimentary traps to create opportunities to make off with ill-gotten gains. Shadow drakes have a particular fascination and admiration for umbral dragons-a notable exception to the norm for drakes and dragons.

0VNX7MbrCqRSKYkE.description:
Trigger A creature attacks the shadow drake while it is in an area of dim light

Effect The shadow drake further obscures its position. The attacker must succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:11] check in order to affect the shadow drake, as if the drake were @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} for the triggering attack.
0VNX7MbrCqRSKYkE.name: Shadow Evade

5IixHzakyftZgS0g.description:
Frequency three times per day

Effect The shadow drake Strides or Flies twice.
5IixHzakyftZgS0g.name: Speed Surge

QNy9Hrx2ib5tkQKt.description: The shadow drake's form shifts and blends reflexively with surrounding shadows. A shadow drake gains an additional reaction each round, but it can use this reaction only for Shadow Evade.
QNy9Hrx2ib5tkQKt.name: Shadow Blend

usIKpszaYrCWfN8r.description:
A shadow drake spits a ball of black liquid that explodes into a cloud of frigid black shadow. This attack has a range of 40 feet and explodes in a 5-foot-radius burst. Creatures within the burst take @Damage[2d6[cold]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:16|basic] save). The explosion of shadow also snuffs out mundane light sources the size of a torch, lantern, or smaller, and attempts to counteract magical light with a +8 counteract modifier.

The shadow drake can't use Shadow Breath again for [[/gmr 1d6]] rounds.
usIKpszaYrCWfN8r.name: Shadow Breath

wnZi8QCOMG86Db4l.description: The shadow drake makes one jaws Strike and two tail Strikes in any order.
wnZi8QCOMG86Db4l.name: Draconic Frenzy

Sun-Scorched Shadow Drake.name: Sun-Scorched Shadow Drake

Swamp Ooze.description:
These amorphous masses of sewage and other detritus make their way through filthy culverts beneath cities large and small.

Slimes, molds, and other oozes can be found in dank dungeons and shadowed forests. While not necessarily evil, some grow to enormous sizes and have insatiable appetites.

VwrlDdZczBGO5Ps4.description: A swamp ooze can sense nearby motion through vibration and air movement.
VwrlDdZczBGO5Ps4.name: Motion Sense 60 feet

mdqK7RuSjtezVyS8.description:
Frequency once per minute

Effect The swamp ooze unleashes a wave of swamp muck filled with sharp debris, covering all creatures within a @Template[emanation|distance:20]. Each creature in the area must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:17|name:Filth Wave|traits:damaging-effect] save or take @Damage[1d4[piercing]] damage and take a -10-foot penalty to its Speeds for 1 minute (on a critical failure, the creature also falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}).

A creature can spend an Interact action to clean someone off, decreasing the Speed penalty by 5 feet with each action.
mdqK7RuSjtezVyS8.name: Swamp Wave

Swamp Ooze.name: Swamp Ooze

Swampy Quicksand.description: A 15-foot-wide patch of water and sand attempts to submerge creatures that step onto it.
Swampy Quicksand.hazardReset: The hazard still submerges anyone who walks in, but the surface doesn't become hidden again until it settles over the course of 24 hours.
Swampy Quicksand.hazardRoutine:
(1 action) On its initiative, the quicksand pulls down each creature within it. A creature that was submerged up to its waist becomes submerged up to its neck, and a creature that was submerged up to its neck is pulled under and has to hold its breath to avoid suffocation.

A creature in the quicksand can attempt a @Check[athletics|dc:18|name:Swim out of Quicksand|traits:action:swim,environmental] check to Swim to either raise itself by one step if it's submerged to its neck or worse, or to move 5 feet if it's submerged only up to its waist. On a critical failure, the creature is pulled down one step. A creature that Swims out of the quicksand escapes the hazard and is prone in a space adjacent to the quicksand patch. Other creatures can Aid the creature, typically by using a rope or similar aid, or attempt to pull the creature out with their own @Check[athletics|dc:18|name:Aid Another Creature in Quicksand] check, with the same results as if the creature attempted the check.
Swampy Quicksand.name: Swampy Quicksand
